name: Traditional Swedish Pancakes
author: Leanne
summary: This is my Scandinavian grandmother's recipe of the traditional Swedish pancake. These are very thin pancakes, rolled up and served with lingonberries and/or sprinkled with confectioners' sugar. These are also good with lemon juice and maple syrup even!
ingredients: 1 teaspoon vegetable oil, or as needed
directions: Beat eggs in a large bowl; add milk, flour, sugar, 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, and vanilla extract and mix until batter is very thin
Heat a griddle or a Swedish plett pan over medium heat; add about 1 teaspoon oil
Pour a small amount of batter onto the griddle and tip griddle to spread the batter into a thin layer; cook until lightly browned, 2 to 3 minutes
Flip pancake and cook until browned on the other side, 2 to 3 minutes more
Roll pancake and place on a plate
